column4: hey does anyone know how i can get my damn DVD drive to stop spinning all the time?
whenever there's a DVD in there, it won't shut up, even if it's not being accessed
try get data cd or mp3 cd for testing if they CD didn't work, look like a laser failed..
do in the terminal box   dmesg  if you find the CD drive model..
i mean what do you want to know about it? it's a standard ATAPI DVD-R/CD-RW
type dmesg in the terminal box and paste to the pastebin.. see below
no, it's a thinkpad thing... i think panasonic manufactures the drives
My old CDRW/DVDRom vibration and replaced the newer CDRW/DVDRom it's works good so far.. I've experince with vibration, replaces every yearly..
it's not vibration, it's just spinning, like normal... just it's not in use
yes, something wrong with CD drive, probably didn't set the DMA on?
that's good, you can eject it out on DVD icon and right mouse click to EJECT, sometime the bazel button didn't work very rarely..
yeah, but i don't WANT to... i ough tto be able to have a disk in there without it spinning
your DVD disc stays on and spinning too long when not in use.. your CD drive might heat up..   Anyone pls help graft, he need to stop spinning a DVD discs in his CD drive..
